content: daisy s bouquet is a simple crochet square with beautiful grape hyacinths created by using popcorn stitches and overlay crochet it is named after the scene in downtown abbey where daisy marries william i have worked up three examples of the square each with a very different feel **square a** for this square i used scheepjes scrumptious and a 4mm hook it has a single-colour background with contrasting colours for the stems and flowers **gauge ** 5 5cm/2 16 at the end of round 3 **size ** 20cm/8 **yardage ** 100m/110yds **square b** for this rainbow square i used scheepjes softfun and a 4mm hook changing colours on every round except the last one **gauge ** 6cm/2 36 at the end of round 3 **size ** 21 5cm/8 5 **yardage ** 110m/120yds **square c** for this square i used scheepjes stone washed xl in a single colour to highlight the texture of the square **gauge ** 7 5cm/2 95 at the end of round 3 **size ** 26 5cm/10 5 **yardage ** 140m/153yds **information** this pattern is written in us terminology with round-by-round photos and charts by the talented masako kawahara there is also a video tutorial if you need step-by-step help 1 this pattern is suitable for adventurous beginners 1 https //youtu be/1b5lh42t_jq
